greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of non-divisors of n reduced modulo n.
comment: Numbers n such that a(n)=0 are: 1, 2, 24, 4320, 4680, ... (see A159907, conjecture by _Jaroslav Krizek_ and further comments). - _Michel Marcus_, Sep 23 2013
Numbers n such that a(n)=n/2 are: 6, 28, 120, 496, 672, ... = A007691 \ {1}. - _Michel Marcus_, Sep 25 2013
link: Jaroslav Krizek, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000.
program: (PARI) a(n) = lift(sum(i=1, n, if (n % i, Mod(i, n), 0))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 23 2013
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Sep 22 2013
